channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: No, judge tells Trump. You can’t cripple $16 billion in funding for New York City and New Jersey
item.description: "Plaintiffs have adequately shown that the public interest would be harmed by a delay in a critical infrastructure project.”

item.title: Ilhan Omar’s husband is rich. The Republican oversight chairman is investigating why
item.description: James Comer's request marked a highly unusual move by the chair of a committee with a history of taking on politically charged investigations.

item.title: Prosecutors Began Investigating Renee Good’s Killing. Washington Told Them to Stop.
item.description: Federal prosecutors had a warrant to collect evidence from Ms. Good’s vehicle, but Trump administration leaders said to drop it. About a dozen prosecu...

item.title: Super Bowl Halftime Is the World’s Biggest Stage. He Designs It.
item.description: From Prince’s giant symbol to Kendrick Lamar’s streetlamps, the set production designer Bruce Rodgers “makes the impossible possible.”

item.title: A Mosque Bombing Undercuts Pakistan’s Bid for Security
item.description: Pakistan has made headway against the Islamic State and other militants, but a bloody suicide attack showed how fragile its progress has been.

item.title: Before Kevin Warsh has even taken over as Fed chair, Trump is joking about suing him. Scott Bessent is fine with that
item.description: When asked about Bessent's remarks, Sen. Thom Tillis said: “even stipulating that that could happen and that it’s not a bad idea is troubling to me.”

item.title: Trump’s Obama Derangement Syndrome
item.description: The president shows, once again, that he shouldn’t be anywhere near the Oval.

item.title: Trump Reverts to Diplomacy With Iran, but the Road Is Narrow
item.description: Iran is skilled at prolonging negotiations over its nuclear program, and seems to be hoping President Trump is out for a quick win, rather than a prol...

item.title: NBA star Giannis Antetokounmpo gets in bed with sports gambling as a Kalshi shareholder
item.description: “The internet is full of opinions. I decided it was time to make some of my own,” the Greek superstar said. “Today, I'm joining Kalshi as a shareholde...

item.title: AI can make anyone rich: Mark Cuban says it could turn ‘just one dude in a basement’ into a trillionaire
item.description: The billionaire former "Shark Tank" star and Dallas Mavericks owner is a dedicated AI user.

item.title: A Mosque Bombing Undercuts Pakistan’s Bid for Security
item.description: Pakistan has made headway against the Islamic State and other militants, but a bloody suicide attack showed how fragile its progress has been.

item.title: Saudis Announce New Investments in Syria, a Sign of Deepening Ties
item.description: Saudi and Syrian officials announced deals ranging from aviation to telecommunications, offering a much-needed boost to Syria’s battered economy.

item.title: Record-Breaking 244-Pound Atlantic Halibut Caught in Quebec
item.description: A huge Atlantic halibut caught in Quebec weighed in at a record-breaking 244 pounds.

item.title: Roland Huntford, Lore-Debunking Historian of Polar Exploration, Dies at 98
item.description: He caused an uproar by challenging the heroic status of Robert Falcon Scott, the Briton who led a doomed quest to the South Pole in 1912.

item.title: Trump Reverts to Diplomacy With Iran, but the Road Is Narrow
item.description: Iran is skilled at prolonging negotiations over its nuclear program, and seems to be hoping President Trump is out for a quick win, rather than a prol...
